values:
*Rocks the fuck out to Janes Addiction*


And you should be doing so too dammit.

A great deal has been happening, but I can't really be arsed posting about it.

One notable event was 2 fridays ago, at the Opera House, where I attended a preformance called "Feasting on Flesh".  The poster for it had the following tagline - "A decadent and deranged degustation of perverse and provocative performance by proud purveyors of wanton weirdness!" 

Part burlesque, part play, part modern dance performance, part circus, and then with a bit more burlesque. It stared, amongst others, Gypsy Wood, who recently toured with Dita Von Teese, and is simply stunning. 
It was one of the most throughly enjoyable nights I've had all year, and the fact that Gotye played live to proivde the score certainly didn't hurt at all. 
Fantastic. I would throughly reccomend it to everyone...But it has finished it run. Oh well. 

Arcturus are touring next year, and I'll be in America when they play Sydney. Typical. Dang.

I cannot fucking believe it's less then a month 'till Xmas. Thats quite simply disturbing. Lucky for me I'm stone motherless broke, makes the whole gift giving enterprise a lot easier. 

And in closing, go see The Prestige. A fantastic headfuck of a movie, but then again I expected nothing less from Christopher Nolan. 
9 out of 10, yet another contender for movie of the year (Seem to be saying that a lot lately...)

Well I survived stocktake week. Barely. 
Now, off too FOTD and then Canberra for M4TB.


Huzzah.

Yeah, I bought the bullet and bought a Roger Waters ticket.
Still, not entirely happy about it fiances involved. Lets put it in perspective people - We are talking about the principal song/lyric writer on two of the top 4 selling albums of all time. 

Seriously, this dude is richer then God.
Does he really need to gouge us so much?

Anyway, I remembered how much I kicked myself after missing the 02 tour, cringed, and forked over for a bronze ticket. I'll just subsit on bread and water for the next week or two.

And now, the weekend beckons.  I've spent all week at work doing soul-crushing, energy draining, exhausting, boring, menial and repetitive stocktake. 
Christ I hate stocktake.
All I want to do is crawl into bed, watch my newly aquired House series 2 DVD then sleep 'till Sunday.
Think I'll give that a try.

http://www.coppel.com.au/artists/RogerWaters/RW06.swf

I've got to appriciate the irony.

In November I'm seeing the Pink Floyd experience play the Dark Side of the Moon in it's entirety.
In Januray, tickets pending, I'll see the esteemed Mr Roger Waters play it in it's entirety himself. And a set of Floyd classics.

Lifes a funny thing, huh?

Well, there goes the money I'd scrounged away for Lou Reed tickets!
I guess I'm a tad let down by this news though - I mean, I cannot wait for this, however, I'd heard a few months ago Coppel was looking to bring out either Waters or Gilmour - Not both though. Looks like Waters won out, so no Gilmour - And I know who'd I prefer by a long fucking shot.

Still, this is going to be awesome. Sure, Waters voice is shot to hell, and his solo work is average at best, but his guitarist can bust out a good enough Gilmour vocal impersonation to carry the songs along. I heard his shows at the EnCent in 02 were unreal. 
Pointless trivia - The reason I didn't go see him in 02 was because, poor lowley year 12 student that I was, I could only afford to go to one concert - him or Tool. Tool of course won out. 
4 years on, I'll be seeing them both on consecutive nights!
Good stuff. And to celebrate, I'm going to listen to Waters best solo album - The one that masquaraded as a Pink Floyd album, The Final Cut.

My assault on the conservative print media continues unabated! 

To those who buy such tripe, The Daily Telegraph printed another of my monthly grumpy old man ranty letters today, (My 5th in just over a year). 
Score another one for the good guys!
Daniel 5,
Facists 0!

And you're next, farcical Current Affairs programs!

It's October!!!!!

When the hell did that happen?!?!?!?!?!?!

Chapter 1:
===============
1.Middle name:
Anthony

2.Nickname(s):
Beard-o (currenty only it seems...) Pepper, (due to my obession with Dr Pepper) M-Jay-Kay. (It's a nerd thing. ) thats it really, I've never really had a proper nick-name, despite my strong desire for one - but you can't really ASK for one now, can you!!! Believe me, I've tried, it's just no the same dammit.

3.Current location:
Taren Point. Work. My lab.

4.Eye colour:
...You know, I don't really know. I'm not going to the bathroom just to look. I've met just about everyone on this forum, you tell me! 

Chapter 2:
===============

1.Do you live with your parent(s):
In transition right now.

2.Do you get along with your parent(s):
Not really..

3.Are your parents married/separated/divorced?
married

4.Do you have any Siblings?:
Yes.

Chapter 3: Favourites
===============
1. Ice Cream:
...Hard to say, its all good, but anything with a SHITLOAD of ice magic on it helps! Honeycomb flavor is awesomeness though.

2. Season:
Winter.

3.Shampoo/conditioner:
I'm using Pears right now. I don't like it, I don't hate it.

Chapter 4: Do You..
===============
1.Dance in the shower?
Who doesn't?

2.Do you write on your hand?
not really.

3.Call people back:
Sometimes if there's a reason to.

4.Believe in love:
Define the context of love? I'd love the Dragons to win, I love my dogs, I love bacon, I love Led Zepplin, I love my freinds, I'd love it if you brough me a JD and coke...
So yeah, I guess.

5.Sleep on a certain side of the bed:
I've been known to wake up inverted in bed. I move around alot. But I'm almost always on my stomach.

6. Any bad habits:
Oh shit yes.
Bite my nails when I'm nervous.
Sloopy eater.
Terible drunk.
General smart-arseness
General Elitism
Loud
shall I go on?

Yes.

Yes.

yup

Yes.

Yes.

Yes.

No.

yes.

Yes.

Yes.

Disturbingly, I think so.

===============

lady in the Water...Don't waste you time. The second last movie i watched though, Thank you for smoking...Now that was awesome!

Chris.

My sister.

Mouse!

Coffee.

Hay.

11.Person you kissed:
Madeleina

Oh, and massive props to Brendan (choppy) for bringing this to my attention.
Tickets have been booked!

Looks like that long rumored Tool tour is imminent...

Ticketmaster had a page for a Tool show at the Myer Music Bowl in Melbourne listed for the 31st of January, which has already been taken down - Someone let the cat out of the bag accidently it seems...
Lucky someone kept it open and screen-capped it!


BDO perhaps?

Dunno how I feel about them doing the festival, almost all reviews from their festival shows on the summer Euro circuit have been negative, but as long as there's side shows...

*sigh*

more money for savings I gotta allocate for a gig...And I srtill haven't paid for Ministry, Metal for the Brain or Nevermore.

Notice how much I complain lately????

Super-dooper ultra props go out to Nikki, your gift was passed along to me from Jen...

You, kind miss, rock!

Just before the weekend begun a wee little package arrived at the doorstep. Seemed the Daria boxset ordered from Canadia nearly 5 months ago finally arrived. And here I was doubting our maple-leaf eating freinds from the north, eeeyy?

Every episode of Daria on DVD. Hmmm. Ergo, I've been binging all weekend then, haven't I? And apart from raising fears that I may very well one day turn out like Jake (but less successful, good times were had by all. Except when I stopped to go to some boring arse family diddley at my Brothers, watch the Bledislo Cup and the Dragons get beaten. The lesson was, never stop watching your DVDs
Now, time for some unabashed quoting!

Trent: "I've been practicing for 10 hours straight."
Jane: "Daria, would you say falling asleep with a guitar in your hands counts as practicing?"
Trent: "It does if you don't drop it." 

-------

Helen - We should have started this earlier.

Jake - (mutters) You sound like my father.

Helen - What?

(Jake gets tent back up during following rant)

Jake - Oh, he knew everything about camping. Course, he had a different approach! No tent for Mad Dog Morgendorffer! Oh, no! No sleeping bag, either! You lash some damn sticks together for a lean-to, slept on a bunch of pine needles, and if it rained, well, tough crap! No tent for Mad Dog Morgendorffer, and no tent for little Jakey, either!

Helen - That's good, honey. You're letting out some of that tension.

Jake - Why couldn't he just love me for who I was?

(Daria and Quinn enter carrying firewood)

Helen - All right, Jake... um, now you're letting out too much tension.

Jake - Why did he think I was still wetting the bed at fifteen? (he looks up) Oh, hi, girls!

----

(camcorder view of Quinn and Tiffany at cosmetics counter)

Quinn - Oh, look! Pore refiner. I'm glad I don't need that. Have you ever noticed how popular people always have the tiniest pores? I wonder why that is?

Tiffany - Your pores are really cute, Quinn.

Quinn - (panics) But you can't seem them, can you?

(Quinn finally notices that Daria is still taping, and does what Daria has been waiting all day for her to do: completely and totally lose her cool)

Quinn - Oh, my God, they've been... they've been zooming! You better not zoom that thing. Stop zooming, I mean it. If you can see any of my pores on camera, I swear, I'll kill you. Stop the tape! I do not have pores! My pores are cute! MY PORES ARE TINY! YOU'RE FIRED!!!!

(Quinn pushes her hand into the camera lens; taping stops in a burst of static)

---

Good times!

And in unrelated news, Ministry are touring. Fan-freaking-fucking-tastic news.

Sooo many good shows coming up, had to happen when I'm saving for my trip to seppo-land, didn't it?

I've said this elsewhere, butI'll say this again, R.I.P Roger "Syd" Barrett.

A massive influence on me in so many ways, and I'll wager, probably you, without even knowing it - The world of rock and pop music owes so fucking much to this great man. And most will never realize it. 



R.I.P

Dang. 
Australia v Italy the same night as Jeff Martin.

grrr.
No choice really, it it?

(Obviously the football wins out...See you next time Jeff!)

Words can't describe how overjoyed I am we made it this far. Yes, we CAN beat Italy...But will we?? Thats the big Q...
 Even if we don't, it matters not. We've exceeded most expectations and done ourselves proud.
Fuck yeah.

In other news, work has become a living hell. Severally understaffed this month, our busiest May and June on record, and immense tiredness due to multiple WC late night games isn't helping. Dang. That situation probably lead to me lack of concentration which led to my mishap and mangled finger. Speaking of which, my finger is still fucked, by the way. I hate being a temporary left handed south paw. How do you people live like this?
The best laugh I've had in ages...

I really, really, really wish I hadn't pissed and moaned about too many dog's here on the weekend, even in jest.
I got home from work today to the news that Elli had had one motherucker of a seizure (Shes epileptic) and it was so sever she's done brain damage. She been so sick lately, she's been throwing up every day and dropping weight something fierce. Mum had her put down. After 15 years (yeah, she was that old) she'd suffered enough. 

The saddest part is watching the other dogs keep roaming around looking for her, barking for her, looking very worried and distressed.  Ellie was the reigning queen of our dog clan. They are so worried for her. They don;t want to eat dinner without her around to have her due share. 

I miss my dog :(

Go see Chumscrubber. Now.
Easilly one of the best films I've seen this year. I could explain it, but that would take about 6 paragraphs. 
In simplest terms one might compare it to, say Donni Darko or Thumbsucker but that would most certainly be beyond oversimplifying and catagorizing and doing it an injustice.

Just trust me on this. Go to your nearest indie cinema and see it. 
Thank me later. 


..




(Kick off in ten and a half hours... Motherfuckohyeah...)

I am currently co-habitating with 7 different canines. 
It is, in all reality, a mad house, and its only from sheer tiredness and annonyance am I refraining on pointing out that "this place has gone to the dogs!"

Apart from the usual suspects (Boof, Elle, Mimmie and BJ), there's Berty (The son of Boof and Mimmie, and BJ's half brother) and Muffy, dog's whose owners are O/s on hollidays, and of course the irrepressable Sumomo, Madeleina's dog, who is here for some reason or another.

7 dogs. You ever try watching a Sccoer match at 2am whilst 7 doys are braying and yelping in the garage to be let in? It's very difficult. And fucking annonying. I nearly missed Germanys cracker of a first goal.

And heaven help you should you try and feed them. It's like one of those scenes from an Africian doco when a school of Pirhanans envelope a helpless anetlope who's stumbled into the river. Chaos. Utter chaos. I came this close to losing a finger last night, I'm sure...

I suppose my frequent lack of sleep from this situation will only aid me in my attempt to establish a nocturnal cycle for the next month of sheer sporting bliss thougt. 

I've been out of contact with the world for a while. Don't supose this will change anytime soon. One of those good-old fashioned self imposed isolations gigs. At least I have the WC to keep me company. And of course the usual stream of weekly sporting goodness.

See you all when I next emerge.

NSW won on wednesday night, the Socceroo's got up Thursday night, my beloved Dragons thrashed the hated Knights last night, and with the Swannies playing an understrength Hawks tonight, I find myself fumbling for superlatives as I offer thanks and praise to the Sporting Gods for their rich and seemingly limitless bounty. The old arse groove in the couch is getting one hell of a workout, and the brand new widescreen plasma has been going non stop, which is all good, as this has been a jolly good warmup/practice run before the upcoming 3 week joyfest otherwise known as the World Cup. Bring.It.On.
Sport, and therefore my life, is good.


All is not well, however, in Daniel land. My loyal, dependable and long surviving and simple phone died yesterday. Although it was approaching its used by date, it was still most anonying as I now had to replace it, and finding a simple phone is not easy these days. I don't give a shit about bluetooth wireless GPS 150megapixal mp3 touchscreen flip video phones (for only a cool $599, or $10 a month for the next 80 years), gimme something thats rings and sends messages and thats it god dammit. 
I have a cmera, I have an ipod, I need a phone.

Alas, much to my dismay upon purchasing the most basic model phone I could find at the virgin store and putting my SIM in, I discovered that it seems most of my phone number contacts and saved SMs's were stored not on my SIM, but my old phone's memory, now dead.
A lot of important and very meaningful saved message can't be recovering. Most annonying. Unless I had a number or saved message from pre-05, it's gone.
So please, I implore my fellow readers, should you fall under that catagory and I had your number, then email or text me with it and I would be most grateful....
Unless you've been waiting for the right oppurtunity to get me outta your life, then now's your chance...Run!

I've decided to put a lot of the negative energy thats been around lately to some good, and pour my anger and frustration into something mildly productive. 

Ergo, I've spent the better part of the last two weeks labouring on a new banner for the Cove. 
Dying, Stencilling, Taping, Painting, Cutting, Sewing...
Despite the fact that my artistic traits number zero, I think I didn't do that bad a job...Considering.



And how did the process look I hear you not asking? Well I'm going to show you anyway God dammit. Thats what you get for reading my LJ.
















Guess this just illustrates that A - I am a loser sports nerd, B - God damn I'm itching for the next season of the A League to start and C - I have waaaay to much fucking time on my hands. The upside of being a fucking pariah.

When it rains it pours...

In the very near future I have to scrounge up the $$$ for tickets to Dragonforce, Jose Gonzales, Pearl Jam, Queensryche and The eels, plus S.F.C. membershsip go one sale nxt week and i want to get in early to get a primo seat in the Cove...

Stupid expensive life.

Oh, and 4 of my 5 tag-ee's for my "10 favourite movies" post are yet to respond in kind...Poor form peep's and peepettes! Get typing!

Here's a rather uninspiried idea (thats probably be done before) that I devised so as too (A) - pass the time at work and (B) - prattle on with my pretensious opinions, as one does:

List your ten favourite movies, explain why, provide a favourite line, and tag 5 fellow Live Journalians to do the same. Its a surprisingly good way to kill some time and trip down the old memory lane. So without furthur apu...

Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
Directed by Python legend Tery Gilliam, and faithfully based on Hunter S. Thompson's classic psychadelic masterpiece, Fear and Loathing... sees Johnny Depp at his method-acting best playing the eccentric Raoul Duke, Thompson's alter-ego in this semi-fictional account of one crazy, drug addled weekend spent in Vegas searching for the American Dream...

"We had two bags of grass, seventy-five pellets of mescaline, five sheets of high-powered blotter acid, a saltshaker half-full of cocaine, and a whole multi colored collection of uppers, downers, laughers, screamers... Also, a quart of tequila, a quart of rum, a case of beer, a pint of raw ether, and two dozen amyls...." - Raoul Duke


Ravenous
Impossible to catagorise, this B Grade is part vampire horror, part cannibal survival, part splatterfest, part black humor and all quality. Set in an isolated army station high in the moutains in the 1840's, it follows a disgraced captain, investigating the dissapearance of a band of travellers, rumored to have started eating each other to survive...Scored by the excellent Damon Albarn (of Blur and the Gorillaz fame), Ravenous shows how much can be done on a small budget but with a great script and quality actors (namely Robert Carlyle and Guy Pearce)

"I said we had no food... I didn't say there was nothing to eat." - Colhoun


Apocalypse Now
A simple review cannot do this film justice. It has to be seen, and experienced, to be believed. If you haven't before, log off your compter and go to the DVD store NOW. Movie's like this are why the medium of film exist. Pretty much perfect.
Simple as that.

" I watched a snail crawl along the edge of a straight razor. That's my dream. That's my nightmare. Crawling, slithering, along the edge of a straight... razor... and surviving... " - Kurtz


The Big Lebowski
The Coen brothers never topped this cult masterpiece. Perhaps one of the most irrevelant movies made, yet utterly engaging, with some of the most quirky, and memorable dialog and characters ever written. Holding the record for the number of times "fuck" is spoken in any film, it is worth viewing just for John Goodman's tour de fource as Walter Sobchezk, an unstable war vetern obsessed with bowling and Vietnam. Essiential viewing.

"Nihilists?! Fuck me. I mean, say what you like about the tenets of National Socialism, Dude, at least it's an ethos." - Walter


The Wall
The cinamatic half of Pink Floyd's classic concept album of the same title, The Wall is the complete realization of Roger Waters dark, bleak svision of a burnt out rockstar on the verge of total breakdown and descent into madness. The blend of visual and sonic imagery is seemless and both surreal and truely stunning and is a required viewing for anyone who has any passion for music.

"Hush now baby, baby, don't you cry. Mother's gonna make all of your nightmares come true. Mother's gonna put all of her fears into you. Mother's gonna keep you right here under her wing. She won't let you fly, but she might let you sing..." - Mother


Office Space
Mike Judges piercingly accurate satire of modern life, to which anyone who has ever worked in in a large office environment an instantly relate. Its accuracy is remarkable, and almost eerie in parts, and may just inspire legions of cube farm workers to rebel against inept management. A modern day cult classic.

"No, not again. I... why does it say paper jam when there is no paper jam? I swear to God, one of these days, I, I'll just kick this piece of shit out the window. " - Samir


Aliens
The second installment in the long running Alien saga, Aliens saw the genre of Survival Horror refined and perfected in a style that has often be imitated but never equalled. One of the few sequals that surpasses the original, Aliens is a dark, atmospheric, gritty sci-fi classic that features Sigourney Weaver at her tough-as-nails best.

"They're coming outta the walls. They're coming outta the goddamn walls!..."  - Hudson


Monty Python's Life of Brian
The most offensive of the Python movies, but without doubt the funniest. Initially banned in scores of countires upon it's realese, it see's the Pythons in thier best ever form and has earnt itself a massive cult following. Ranked by many critics as the funniest film ever...So much so it caused me to wet myself with laughter on first viewing. Yes, it's that good.

"All right, but apart from the sanitation, medicine, education, wine, public order, irrigation, roads, the fresh water system and public health, what have the Romans ever done for us?"  - Reg


Reservior Dogs
Tarantino's first major hit, this movie is virtually flawless. Filled with snappy, witty dialog, tense atmosphere, trademark directing and thick helpings of violence and crime, it set a trend for which Tarantino would follow to this day. A massively influential semenial classic, Reservior Dogs can be credited for starting a whole new genre of modern films.

"Listen kid, I'm not gonna bullshit you, all right? I don't give a good fuck what you know, or don't know, but I'm gonna torture you anyway, regardless. Not to get information. It's amusing, to me, to torture a cop. You can say anything you want cause I've heard it all before. All you can do is pray for a quick death, which you ain't gonna get." - Mr Blonde


Transformers - The Movie
Dismissed as a mere childrens film, this movie shaped my younger years. Surprisingly dark and bleak at points, this epic deals with many theme's lost on it's primary target audience - Death, life, hope, war, hate, despair and comradship. With a cheesy 80's soundtrack, corney "moving" moments, lots of explosions and cutting edge animation, you simply didn't live life as a 8 year old until you saw this...

"For a time, I considered sparing your wretched little planet, Cybertron. But now, you shall witness... its DISMEMBERMENT. " - Unicron



And thats that...
TAGGED! 
Prisonofdesire, Unclechopchop, Slaughters, Rogerkilljoy, Apolyom_Todd

Another day, another rant.

At work eariler today, over lunch, a co-worker was reading the paper. Apparently some manner of article about the new smart cards (And i'll save my rant about THEM for later)...

Anyway, she half looked up and said something to me along the lines of:
"Huh, how about that..."

Bored, I sighed, put down the sports section crossword and took the bait, asking "Yeah? How about what?"

"Well, some dude was quoted as saying these cards makes us one step closer to a big brother state...Wow! You know a TV show is popular when its name and concept starts becoming part of the normal vocab!"

I paused for a frantic few seconds, desperatley searching for ANY sarcasm or jest in her voice...Disturbingly, there was none...I knw then that this was going to be one of those conversations..

"You...Your serious, aren't you?" I asked.

"Huh? About what???"

Then that dull, throbbing sensation in my head started. You know the one, where you just know that your talking to someone so stupid it's probably killing off your brain cells... 

"So...You actualy think the term "Big Brother", in this context, started with the reality TV show?"

She looked at me quite confused and and replied "Well of course! it's been going for ages! 6 years I think now! Yeah, it started when I was at school! I,ve seen them all!"

I still was waiting for her to burst out laughing, admit she was taking the piss. This didn't happen...

"...So...does the name "Orwell" mean anything to you at all?" I asked feebly. She returned a confused and blank look.

"Erm...No, should it?"

*sigh* "Not to you, prole"

I then decided to leave the room in a hurry so as not to yell at the poor, ignorant girl. 
Isn't ANYONE educating these people in their youth????

I decided to take a good old fashioned sickie this morning, as you do. Called Troy at work, croaked and moaned and stammered some theatrical spiel about being bed-ridden all weekend, feeling like dogshit, and doubting I could get out of bed, let alone to work. He bought it, or at least gave the impression he did, and that was that.

Feeling rather pleased with myself, I settled back into bed, turned my snooze alarm off, and was about to doze off when suddenly I remembered that yesterday, as me and a few mates were leaving WIN stadium in Wollongong after watching the Dragons trounce the Bronco's, I ran into Vicky and her husband -  both Bronco fans...Vicky is the work 2IC. We had chatted about the game for a few minutes and I was quite animated and cheery about the result.... 

Opps...
So fucking much for being bed-ridden all weekend....

:-/

Upon my enivatble arrival at work I hurridly explained that I was suddenly feeling much better...
Fooled no one. 

Great start to the week...

Memo : To whom it may concern in the music industry.

Dear Sir and/or madam.
FUCKING QUIT IT.
Every fucking time someone at work turns on your shitty pop radio stations all I hear are classic songs butchered, mutilated, raped, stripped of their soul and squeezed out of your cookie-cutter 15 minutes of fame instant-hit trendifying pop factorys.
Classics don't fucking need dance re-mixes. They don't need turntables and beat boxing and rapping on them. They don't need to be set to a trance tehcno beat of 300BPM's. They don't need skanky 30+ whores slutting up trendy MTV filmclips.
They don't need it, we don't want it, it should be crinimal. 

This morning it was Cream's 'Sunshine of Your Love'
Cream! Clapton, for fucks sake! Is noting sacred to you god-damn whores?

Quit it, seriously, your really starting to shit me.

Updating less and less these days. Hmmm..

My 21st was good. Piccies up soon.

Being present to watch the mighty FC storm home over the Mariners was an amazing experience. Despite the poor first half, it was sensational overall. I've already registered my interest in being a member next year. 

Speaking of memberships, I'm now a Red V St George Dragons member. Robb, Scott, nurk and James got me it for my birthday...And got my Birthday card signed by Trent Barret, Mark Gasiner and Ben Hornby. I think I wet myself.
More on my patry later.
Feels weird talking about my birthday even though its not actually untill nxt Thursday.

The Haunted and Exodus were great. Good gig, pity about it being Tuesday night. Good to catch up with Todd and Tweeky too. Good times. 

Thats about all for now, I'll post more soon.
I'm sure you all can't wait.
Daniel

Melbourne smells funny. Seriously. 
Other then that it was fine. Awesome food, I'll give them that. If you're ever down there, make a point to stop off at the BBNT franchise (Burgers, Burritoes, Nachoes and Taco's) or the Lord of the Fries eatery on Flinders Street...Seriously the best fries in the world. No, really. And vegen too (if you choose the right sauces...), for those of you so inclinded. Something for everyone.

Stopped by the M.C.G and had a transcending cosmic feeling of peace, serenity and humbility. Such a moment. Pity I didnt have the camera. You all would have seen me drooling. For some reason. Went to some other touristy places. Felt daggy trying to navigate the tram system. Those whacky Victorians and their light rail.

Caught a few gigs down there, went to a few clubs, caught up with some good freinds and good times were had by most. Most of the time. Yup. Nice trip. 


---

I read in the paper today a couple are being charged with killing 6 puppies by bashing their skulls in with a hammer. 
Seriously.
What.The.Fuck.

You know those creative judges who give ironic punishments? I'd love one of them to let me go to work on them with the very same hamer. Fucking hell, what the fuck is wrong with people.

I jet off down to Melbourne tomorrow. 
Wave when I fly overhead ok?

Part1

Just in case you didn't already know, Nick Cave is THE fucking man.
No if's, not buts. I'm glad we cleared this up.

Part2

I'm seriously getting the shits with how all of a sudden Johnny Cash is becoming a fashion pop icon, ala The Ramones. I mean, believe me, it irrated me enough when it became lasts years thing to sport brand new pre-faded and torn Ramones shirts, (retailing for $80 at a Jeans West or whatever), but not being a huge Ramones fan I could pretend it, and the uber-trendy rock-revival bullshit didn't annony me that much...
But when did it become Cash? You cannot walk down the street in the city without seeing at least half a dozen sheep in their black CASH shirts, every one the same picutre of him flipping the bird. Yes, its a cool shirt, but funnily enough, I didnt see that 3 or 4 years ago. I feel like stopping each and every one of them and asking them whats their favourite album? Sure, some would be geniune fans, but I'll bet dollars to donuts that at laest half shurg and mumbled "Umm...I duno, that prison one??"
And now 'Walk The Line' is only making it worse. Don't get me wrong, more exposure for the great man is awesome, but a lot of its in the wrong way, with the wrong marketing spin, and with the wrong type of impressionable idiots lapping it up. 
Mark said it best - he wants to make a shirt with a photoshoped image of Johnny Cash wearing a Ramones shirt on it....

Adios.

Flicking through the right wing rag that is the Daily Telegraph yesterday to kill boredom at work, and came across the letters page. 
Glancing down, this letter caught my eye (Slightly paraphrashed...)

"I've read that England has banned all bird imports after finding a dead parrot in quarantine, suspected for having Avian Flu. Are they sure? Perhas they should ask John cleese for a second opinion - It may just be pining for the fjords..."

I piseed myself laughing, very loudly, in the breakroom. A few co-workers strolled over and glanced at what I was still giggling at. They read it once, twice, three times, looked at me puzzled and confused, read it again, shrugged and walked away.
The same morons quote Rove back and forth every Wednesday morning and haw-haw like lame donkeys. 

People. Pffftt.

TO : The A.C.B (Australian Cricket Board)

RE : Fuck You.

To whom it may concern.
We (The cricket loving public of Australia) wish to convey to you all just how much we hate you. For years we have asked, begged, pleaded, threatened and wept in regards to your selection process. We have watched with dismay your antiquated methods (i.e Caetain players far beyond their prime and with one foot in the grave and one of a bananna peel...And keeping them on for yet another season). We have watched with dismay as your internal suabbles have robbed the team of their infrastructure (i.e Letting Lillee go as defensive coach over a simple pay dispute). We have watched as your smug complacency and reliance on waning results as justification has robbed our beloved green caps of their sheen. And now we are watching the end of a generation, of an era, of a dynasty. The ashes. The rot has set in, and much like our rugby playing compatriots in the Wallabies there will be no quick fix. Now is the time to rebuild. 
Fuck you all. You have pissed all over one of our proudest sporting traditions. 
Of course, it would be pointless to place ALL the blame on you...

...

Australia cricket team, take a seat. Warney, McGrath, step outside boys. You got nothing to answer for. As for the rest of you...SHAME. Whilst I do believe *some* of you have made an effort to the best of your fading abilites, and have had glimpses of what could have been, the fact is some of you no longer deserve to remain at prime level. Some time in the A's should either straighten you out, or indicate that this decision is justified. You know who you are. Others have let complacency slip into their game. They best iron this out before it becomes far too set in...Hard work is your only option. 
Hayden... Do the honerable thing. Kill yourself. Please. Your 5th test 100 only served to show what you once were and contrast your current dismal form. Goodbye. And last but not least, our pround skipper, who will forever be known for losing the Ashes after 18 glorious years...WHAT THE FUCK WERE YOU THINKING. One captains knock (in the 3rd) does NOT excuse the confusing, mysterious and downright stupid tactical decisions made by you. Sending the Poms into bat!?!? Take the fading lighgt option when defeat seemed certain? 
Step down. Gilly deserves your job. 

Take a long hard look at yourselves. You've disapointed a whole nation when you had the talent and ability to remain on top. Shame

The definition of anonying?
Arriving at Aussie Stadium at 3:45 for todays A-Leauge match between Sydney FC and Melbourne Victory (5:00pm kickoff), expecting your friends to arrive as per planned at 4:00 - 4:15, and having them finally show at 5:20...
by which stage, even though the game was well in progress, the lines still meant we probably wouldn't get in 'till half time. We gave up and watched the game ina  bar in Fox Studios, with me sulking most of the way through.

In ten years time when the A Leauge rivals the 3 other footy codes, I can tell people "Yup, I was almost there at the first game!"

Dang. Oh well, managed to catch up brriefly with Bianca ( ) which is always cool.

The definition of bliss?
Pizza Hut all your can eat, (Saturday night). Mousse ist Krieg! I shall be returning soon

Otherwise the weekend was uneventful. Most of the time was spent in Newtown with Maddy. After a lot of discussion we've both decided we over-reacted, even though (apparently) I was in the wrong initially (Yeah, I guess i can admit it...)
We marked 5 months together today, by watching the Futrama DVD we watched the first day we spent together. Coincidently it was not delibertly at first, we just jumped on the couch, cooked up some jaffles, poped in a DVD and when we realized the significance watched the whole thing through and reminisced. Sappy, yes, but thats how we are.

The Roosters are a slight chance of making the finals! And the dragons are a fair chance of stealing the minor premiership, or at least hopefully finishing in the top 2 (a top 4 finish is now certain) Oh happy days!

What a stunning victory by the proud sons of Kograh. Noble opponents, those Eel's were, they put up a worthy challenge, but in the end, victory to the mighty saints. Although I suspect we'll met again in the GF (Either them of the Tigers...)
Ahh, the stains of Paramatta stadium have been wiped clean from my mind.
The mighty Swannies also showed that they arte now Flag favourites by wiping the fucking floor with the Roos by over 60 points - this time last year the Swanies went into 4th quarter against them with a 39 point lead and lost...
Another demon exercised.

I don't even want to talk about the fucking Wallabies. Gregan must go. NOW. I've been saying this for 2 years. No one listened. As usual.

The weekend just passed prooved amazing satisfying, and I feel oddly content for a sunday night. How stange.

Friday night was a blink run, which was short lived when Danea was booted out at 1.30 for bringing in outside booze, and she stormed home, me and Maddy following suit. Still, the night was very enjoyable, starting at Mad's house (where I dyed her hair and trimmed her fringe), with some light drinks, then progressing through the city, where we ran into a calvacade of people, Bianca and Megan from my school days, Nurk, Bec and Cath ( ) returning from NiN, Blacktown Megan and Roman, and Bill and Yasmin. It was one of those nights. Enjoyable, even if I never met up with Conor and Chris at Blink as planned.

Saturday was one HELL of a sleep-in, for no good reason (God I love weekends), then DVD's and pizza 'till the night. Mad and I then trekked down to the Empire at Annadale to catch Celestial play, and I can't remember a better local gig this year. Again, we ran into a score of people, and the atmosphere was just really great. Hung and drank with Tweek, which was a long time coming, caught up briefly with Toddy ( ) and met his charming g.f. Jess (Who I was surprised to find actually knew who I was), chatted to jody for the first time in a while, saw Tim and Ryan (who hung with us through A.D's set), did a bit of the filming of the gig, and just generally enjoyed the music and the evening. I'd forgotten how much fun it is to hit the local scene. A fucking great night, and an awesome set from Todd on his last night in the band. Good luck mate. 

On the way home we stopped for gelatto and stayed up late watching Futurama DVD's. And life was good.

Today, again, a massive sleep-in (Is there a better quality then laziness? I think not!) then I returned to the shire and hit the Bangor Tav to watch the footy with Chris and Conor . All and all a great weekend, in which i got to see and catch up with some great people I don't see as often as I'd like too, and it was all rather cheap as well! Everyone wins!
